snippet: The Red Sox turned to John Farrell, their former pitching coach, to turn around a team that had disintegrated under Manager Bobby Valentine.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column says that Boston Red Sox turned to John Farrell, their former pitching coach, to turn around a team that had disintegrated under Manager Bobby Valentine; notes that only seven managers have switched teams and required compensation, and Farrell is the third to win a World Series with his new team.
lead_paragraph: The Red Sox turned to John Farrell, their former pitching coach, to turn around a team that had disintegrated under Manager Bobby Valentine.

headline.main: Farrell Brought Consistency to a Franchise in Chaos
headline.print_headline: Farrell Brought Consistency to a Franchise in Chaos
